Victims like Katherine Hennepin, a young woman strangled and stabbed in her home. A single suspect with a solid alibi leads to a dead endÃ¢â‚¬â€one even Alex DelawareÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s expert insight canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t explain. The only thing to do is move on to the next murder caseÃ¢â‚¬â€because thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s always a next one.
 
This time the victim is Ursula Corey: a successful, attractive divorcÃƒÂ©e whoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been gunned downÃ¢â‚¬â€not a robbery but an execution, a crime that smacks of simple, savage revenge. And along with that theoretical motive come two strong contenders for the role of perp: the dead womanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s business partner/ex-husband and her divorce lawyer/secret lover. But just as Alex and Milo think theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re zeroing in on the most likely suspect, a bizarre new clue stirs up eerie echoes of the unsolved Hennepin murder. And the discovery of yet another crime scene bearing the same taunting signature raises the specter of a serial killer on a mission, whose twisted method is exceeded only by his manipulative and cunning madness
